cards.front: What are Newton's three laws of motion?
cards.back:
1. An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by a net force.
2. The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.
3. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

questions.stem: What is the third law of motion, also known as the action-reaction principle, stated in terms of two bodies interacting?
options: For every action, there is no reaction.
The action and reaction forces are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction.
The action force is greater than the reaction force.
When a body acts on another, it does not experience any force.
questions.rationale: The third law of motion states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. This principle applies to interactions between two bodies.

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion Insight
insights.takeaway: Newton's First Law (Law of Inertia) states that an object at rest tends to stay at rest, and an object in motion tends to stay in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

cards.back: A subset of artificial intelligence that uses statistical algorithms to enable computers to learn and improve from experience.

cards.front: What are the main types of Machine Learning?
cards.back: Supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.

cards.front: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
cards.back: Supervised learning uses labeled data to train a model, while unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data for pattern recognition.

questions.stem: What is the fundamental goal of a machine learning algorithm?
options: A) To generate new data from existing datasets
B) To find patterns and make predictions based on given input data
C) To improve the performance of the hardware it runs on
D) To provide explanations for the decisions made by the algorithm
questions.rationale: Machine learning aims to learn from data and then make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed.
